text: George Carroll (January 6, 1922 – January 14, 2016) was an American lawyer. He was an important civic figure in Contra Costa County, California and the city of Richmond.Richmond courthouse named for retired judge George Carroll, Bay City News Service, 24-02-2009, access date 25-02-2009 He was born in Brooklyn, New York. He was the first black lawyer in Richmond, California. In 1961 Carroll became the first African American elected to the city council (1961–1964)Richmond's Black History Corner, city of Richmond website, access date 25-02-2009 and later became the first black mayor of Richmond (1964–1965) or any large American city. Carroll died in his sleep on January 14, 2015 in Richmond, California from respiratory failure at the age of 94. ==References== Category:1922 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Deaths from respiratory failure Category:American judges Category:Lawyers from California Category:American mayors Category:American civil rights activists Category:Politicians from Brooklyn Category:Politicians from California Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:People from Richmond, California
title: George Carroll (judge)
